resources.string: CHelix is the official club of Civil department for fest nimbus.
Ojas is the official club of EEE department for fest nimbus.
Medextrous is the official club of Mechanical department for fest nimbus.
Vibhav is the official club of ECE department for fest nimbus.
Team .exe is the official club of CSE department for fest nimbus.
Design-o-crats is the official club of Architecture department for fest nimbus.
Hermetica is the official club of Chemical department for fest nimbus.

NIMBUS is the annual technical festival of National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur, Himachal Pradesh, India. It is touted to be an amalgamation of ideas, expressions, innovations, prototypes, knowledge channels, taken to the most premier levels. Nimbus has become the biggest technical festival of Northern India.
NIMBUS is the annual technical festival of NIT Hamirpur, Himachal Pradesh, India. Nimbus has become the biggest technical festival of Northern India.
A Open Source Project by AppTeam NITH for TechFest Nimbus2k16.\n\nSource code available at GitHub.

by AppTeam
2nd - 3rd April, 8am - 8pm
Venue: Auditorium

 "A hackathon, a hacker neologism, is an event when programmers meet to do collaborative computer programming." -Wikipedia

 This is NITH's first Hackathon being organised by the AppTeam NITH. This event aims at unleashing the innovative abilities of students and highlighting their creativity. As participants require technical assistance, being not very technically sound, it was decided that the participants would be teamed under the Mentors from final year CSE. Teams would be required to build any viable application/library/software in stipulated time of 24 hours. The best innovation will be awarded.


List of Mentors/Team Leaders:-

 1. Akashit Wal
 2. Pradyot 
 3. Shubham Choudhary
 4. Himanshu Singh
 5. Sagar Karira
 6. Prateek Prasher
 7. Akshendra Pratap
 8. Prikshit Tekta
 9. Sahil Badyal
 10. Mayank Bansal


Rules:

 1. Participants must register at website or through app.
 2. Teams participants must be from NIT.
 3. Participants have liberty to list Preference of their Mentors.
 4. Participants will be alloted a team Mentor randomly or based upon skills/preferences.
 5. List of Mentors are given above.
 6. In case of any discrepancy the final decision will be that of Appteam/Judges.
 7. Participants must be present at the event site.


Awarding Schemes:

Winner: 3 Virtual Gold Coins + Additional 35 Virtual Silver Coins

First Runner Up: 2 Virtual Gold Coins + Additional 25 Virtual Silver Coins

Second Runner Up: 1 Virtual Gold Coins + Additional 15 Virtual Silver Coins

Every participants will be awarded 25 Virtual Silver Coins.
